Yeah, it has been taking a while to get work done to Openglad-e, but
Yan and I are still working on it. School has been the main cause of
delay. I didn't do any coding for fun for the past 3 months due to a
super busy quarter at UCSB (go computer science). I am on winter
break now and have spent the past couple days working on Openglad-e.

As mentioned elsewhere, we are doing a lot of work on the code
structure, class relationships, etc, and I made some significant
progress on that this week. Check these screenshots out:

http://snowstorm.sourceforge.net/screenshots/openglad-e_two_levels.jpg
http://snowstorm.sourceforge.net/screenshots/openglad-e_viewrez.jpg

The first screenshot shows two views, with a different level loaded in
each, and both levels actually being played on by the AI. I doubt we
will include the capability of having two teams playing different
levels at once in the final version, but it gives a good idea of how
much more flexible our current code is.

The second screenshot is similar to the previous one but just shows an
increase in window resolution, allowing nearly two full sized views.
Imagine playing at 1024x768 fullscreen with 4 players, all players
having a nice sized playing field.

Also, note the awesome new grass tile, created by Warren Wilkinson. 

Sean
